title: Cat. 82.2  Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina  
1894/95  
Wood-block print in black ink, over brush and solvent thinned and selectively applied ocher, reddish-orange and touches of green wax-and-resin-based media (est.), on cream wove paper; 150 × 120 mm (image/sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Frank B. Hubachek, 1947.471  
Guérin 44, Kornfeld 32  
For the verso, see fig. 82.2.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Sold by Gerald Cramer (1916–1991), Geneva, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1947.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 146, cat. 32.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed in wood block, lower left, printed in white-line manner: P G O

Inscribed along right edge, in graphite: 16079 [sideways]

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 82.2 Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95.

fig. 82.2.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95. The Art Institute of Chicago, 1947.471.

</section>
